result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy C Dyess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Application is scanned under case
completion of SPD representation
DNA Collection done on 05-09-2022 at 10:45 am

9:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy C Dyess in court.  Attorney Juan Ramirez on behalf of Alexander J. Kostal in court for Jeremy C Dyess. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Atty Kostal is out sick today.  
Atty Ramirez indicates he would go forward as long as he can speak with the defendant before to make sure he is comfortable.
Parties go off the record. 
Back on the record at 10:20am with same appearances as above. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Defendant indicates he would like to proceed today with Atty Ramirez. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Cts 1 & 2 of amended information- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: Cts 1 & 2 GUILTY. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$250 fine on each count+ Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge, 60 days to pay.
RCAP Progress Report

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy C Dyess in court.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Jeremy C Dyess. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates they have an offer but defendant needs to complete TASC, requests a COP date in late May. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt: atty Kostal
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeremy C Dyess appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Jeremy C Dyess. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:45 am.
